intro: Centaurea amadanensis, commonly known as the Amadan thistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southeastern Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has lance-shaped leaves with rough, hairy surfaces. Its flowers are usually purple or pink, and they bloom from late spring to early summer. Centaurea amadanensis is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
